div.h1: District Update and Q&A During Coronavirus School Closure

div.script: var multimediaGallery8784 = { "props": { "defaultGallery": true, "imageWidth" : 960, "imageHeight" : 500, "pageModuleInstanceId": "8784", "moduleInstanceId": "7807", "virtualFolderPath": "/cms/lib/TX01800016/Centricity/ModuleInstance/7807/" }, "records": [ { "flexDataId": "24584", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "District Update and Q&A During Coronavirus School Closure - April 9, 2020", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "Lake Travis ISD Superintendent Dr. Brad Lancaster provides staff and parents with an update and Q&A on district operations during the Covid-19 school closure.", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/TX01800016/Centricity/Domain/1210/Brad Facebook Live Thumbnail.jpg", "imageWidth": "1565", "imageHeight": "1117", "imageAltText": "Brad Lancaster's image on Facebook Live", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "Watch Recorded Video from Facebook Live", "videoIsEmbedded": "True", "videoIframe": "" }, {}] };

h1.aria-label: Superintendent to provide district update and Q&A via Facebook Live at 4:00 pm, Thurs. Apr. 23
h1.span: Superintendent to provide district update and Q&A via Facebook Live at 4:00 pm, Thurs. Apr. 23

div.p:
Lake Travis ISD Superintendent of Schools Dr. Brad Lancaster will take to Facebook Live once again where he will provide an overview on our school closure plans for the remainder of the year. He will also attempt to answer as many questions as possible during the alloted time. The event is scheduled for 4:00 p.m., Thursday, April 23.
Please note, the video will be posted on the district's YouTube channel (ltisdschools) at the conclusion of the Facebook Live event; no account is required for viewing. As a reminder, LTISD has a dedicated webpage to keep staff, parents and the community informed on district operations and resources regarding COVID-19. Visit www.ltisdschools.org/covid19 to access latest news and information, online learning, parent tools, and community resources.
Sincerely,

Marco Alvarado
Director of Communications, Media & Community Relations

h1.aria-label: Governor extends school closure through remainder of 2019-2020 school year
h1.span: Governor extends school closure through remainder of 2019-2020 school year

div.p: Dear Lake Travis ISD Staff, Parents and Guardians,

As you may already know, Governor Greg Abbott earlier today announced the “opening of Texas” will begin to occur in various stages. However, he also indicated all public and private schools will remain closed through the remainder of the current school year. Please note, the current school year will not be extended into the summer.

While LTISD buildings and facilities will remain closed, we will continue to engage our students through our online learning platform. We will also continue to provide essential operations as needed including grab and go meals, cleaning and custodial services, and other critical functions. As we have done throughout the closure, all district employees will continue to be paid, and I fully expect our employees to continue to be paid next year as well.

Additionally, the governor’s order results in the cancellation of all LTISD events scheduled through Friday, May 22, our final day of instruction for the current school year. These cancelled events include our Lake Travis High School graduation ceremony originally scheduled to be held Friday, May 22 at Cavalier Stadium. Instead, LTHS staff will provide a virtual ceremony for our seniors and their families on Friday, May 22, and plans are in progress for an alternate graduation event to be held in person on Saturday, August 1 at the HEB Center at Cedar Park.

I know you have many questions regarding the return of school-issued items such as books, uniforms, technology devices and other materials, the pickup of personal belongings, and the status of summer school, camps and other such programs. I will be hosting another Facebook Live event late next week where I will attempt to answer these and other questions. Additional details for the event will be shared with you next week.
In the meantime, I ask for your continued patience, flexibility and support. Please know I will keep you updated with any developments. I wish you and your family much health during this time.

Sincerely,
Brad Lancaster, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

h1.aria-label: District outlines alternate plans for high school graduation events
h1.span: District outlines alternate plans for high school graduation events

p.span: April 15, 2020

div.p: Dear Students, Parents and Guardians of the Lake Travis High School Class of 2020,

Normally, this is the time of year when I send my first senior parent letter outlining important dates for our soon-to-be graduates as they begin to wrap up their high school career at Lake Travis. We know it is an understatement to say that the spring semester has been challenging. Under the guidance and support of our district’s administration, I want you to rest assured that my staff is doing everything possible to make the best of the unique situation we find ourselves in as the Cavalier Nation.

Graduation is an important milestone, and we are going to attempt to honor that tradition with an adjusted celebration. Our hope, however slim it may be, is to hold our graduation ceremony as previously scheduled on Friday, May 22 at Cavalier Stadium. However, should May 22 not be an option due to restrictions on public gatherings, I would like to share our contingency plan for graduation.

A committee of LTHS high school parents, teachers, and administrators recently met to discuss viable options and contingency plans for our graduation ceremony. During tonight’s school board meeting, I presented the committee’s recommendation to offer a virtual graduation on Friday, May 22 as well as an in-person ceremony to be held Saturday, August 1 at the Cedar Park Center. Although the in-person ceremony will be later this summer, our hope is that most of the LTHS Class of 2020 will choose to celebrate with us before graduates matriculate to the next stage in life.

p.span: Obviously, our contingency plan for the August 1 in-person event will be guided and ultimately determined by any health orders mandated by state and/or county officials.

b.i: Please note, however, the virtual ceremony will be provided Friday, May 22 regardless of restrictions on public gatherings. Information pertaining to the virtual ceremony will be shared with students and parents soon.

div.p: Thank you students and parents for your patience, understanding and flexibility during this unprecedented time. Nonetheless, we are proud of your perseverance and look forward to celebrating your success.
Sincerely,

p.span: Gordon Butler
Principal, Lake Travis High School

h1.aria-label: Superintendent to provide update and Q&A via Facebook Live, 4:00 pm, Thurs. Apr. 9
h1.span: Superintendent to provide update and Q&A via Facebook Live, 4:00 pm, Thurs. Apr. 9

p.span: Join Lake Travis ISD Superintendent of Schools Dr. Brad Lancaster for a district update and Q&A session via
at 4:00 p.m., Thursday, April 9.

h1.aria-label: Food & Nutrition Services offering select 'take and bake' items
h1.span: Food & Nutrition Services offering select 'take and bake' items

p.span: Beginning, Monday, April 13, our Food and Nutrition Services (FANS) Department will be adding a variety of items to our current Grab ‘n Go meals.

div.p: Each Monday and Thursday, FANS staff will offer "take and bake" lunch options featuring burgers, pizza, hot dogs and cheesy French bread. Each entree will include heating instructions for students to enjoy their hot meal at home.

p.span: For questions or comments, please contact our Food and Nutrition Services Department at

h1.aria-label: Elective courses available in Schoology beginning Monday, April 6
h1.span: Elective courses available in Schoology beginning Monday, April 6

p.span: April 3, 2020
Dear Lake Travis ISD Parents and Guardians,

As we continue to add opportunities to our LTISD Online Learning platform, students in grades K-12 can access elective courses in Schoology beginning Monday, April 6. These offerings include art, music, PE, foreign language, Career and Technical Education and other electives.

Please be reminded that courses and other instructional content may only be accessed when students are logged into their respective accounts in Schoology. In other words, students cannot access content using parent login credentials.

We look forward to providing these elective courses for our students. Questions or concerns should be directed to your child’s teacher via email. We appreciate your patience with and support of our online learning platform.
Sincerely,
Elizabeth Deterra
Assistant Superintendent for Learning & Teaching Services

h1.aria-label: Update on free meals to children 0-18 years of age
h1.span: Update on free meals to children 0-18 years of age

p.span: As of March 26, the US Department of Agriculture now allows school districts to serve meals to a parent or guardian without his/her children having to be present in the vehicle. However, there are guidelines parents and guardians must follow.

div.p: Guided by the USDA, the Texas Department of Agriculture requires the parent or guardian to present validation of their children with any one (1) of the following options:

li.span: Official letter/email/electronic school application from the school listing the indiviudal child's current enrollment
Report card for each individual child
Attendance record from parent portal of the school website, printed or electronic, for each individual child
School ID of each individual child

h1.aria-label: District provides information for families regarding March 26 launch of LTISD Online Learning
h1.span: District provides information for families regarding March 26 launch of LTISD Online Learning

p.span: March 24, 2020
Dear Lake Travis ISD Parents and Guardians,
Through this communication, LTISD Learning & Teaching Services hopes to give you the tools and guidance necessary to ensure that profound learning experiences take place as we begin

on Thursday, March 26. We also want to assure you LTISD understands the circumstances many of our families are going through right now, including the fact many of our students may be responsible for watching their younger siblings. We pledge to be flexible and work with our families to ensure the exceptional education we are known for still takes place during this time. We encourage you to keep in touch with your child(ren)’s educator(s) throughout our Online Learning process to let them know how learning is happening in your home. Here is some information about Online Learning our families should know:

LTISD Online Learning is an educational learning experience in which there is a physical separation of educators and learners during instruction. These learning experiences include the facilitation of educator to learner, as well as learner to learner communication opportunities.

p.b: What does Online Learning mean for my child?
p.span: This means your child will be working through daily learning experience in order to support all areas of their learning. Educators will design the experiences using online resources.
Schoology is the district adopted learning management platform which integrates with state-adopted online textbooks.

p.b: What will be taught during LTISD Online Learning?
p.span: We are working to ensure consistency within instruction across the district and adhering to our Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills (TEKS). We will be continuing with our 2019-2020 scope and sequence of coursework; however, the delivery will now be virtual. We will be prioritizing core classes (Language Arts, Math, Science, and Social Studies) initially,
and will begin incorporating electives into the weekly online learning experiences.

p.b: What if my learner receives specialized services through Special Education, 504, Dyslexia, English Language Learner, Dual Language or Gifted and Talented?
p.span: We are working to ensure access to instruction for learners with a variety of needs. We are continuing to take guidance from the state and federal government in meeting these needs. While the main instruction will be guided by the general education teacher, specialized services and support will be provided to each learner based on their individual needs. Along with instructional activities, we are designing ways to continue to provide therapies in Individualized Education Plans (IEPs) such as speech, occupational therapy, physical therapy, social skills, behavior consultation, parent training, and counseling as a related service. Each individual program will work in collaboration with educators and families to be sure that learning plans meet the needs of our learners in light of the current circumstances.

These circumstances will require a modification in how assessments (including daily assignments, homework, quizzes, and tests) are designed and delivered. The type of assignments, the number of assignments, as well as the number of quizzes/tests and how they are delivered and assessed will necessarily be reduced to limit the amount of time required for students to prepare for and complete. We are striving to ensure a
healthy balance of 1.) online and offline learning experiences, 2.) physical activities and mindfulness brain breaks, and 3.) academic and social-emotional needs of your child.

li.span: - It will be important for you to assist as needed logging into your devices and ensuring your child is accessing the learning provided. Younger learners may need more support with logging into and navigating through the various applications for learning as they get started.
- It will be important for you to monitor your child’s learning as well as monitor them when they are using their devices.

li.b: Reading Communication from Educators and Reaching Out
li.span: It will be very important for you and your child to be knowledgeable of the communication happening with emails to parents as well as daily messages or agenda items for learners within their schedules. We are asking that you please reach out to your educator if you are having issues with accessing the learning experiences as well as to submit a
if you are having issues with your device or wireless access.

p.b: Schoology How To’s and Access, Log-in, Navigation to Online Resources
p.span: To ensure we have given all of our families and learners the time to get acclimated with this new type of online learning, we encourage you to review the help resources to access the learning management system Schoology, as well as the online resources through our student learning portal necessary to help support their overall learning. If you need assistance logging in or working with Schoology, please email
, and we will assist you as soon as possible.

For information on additional topics including wireless accessibility/free internet access, library resources, updates from the Texas Education Agency, State of Texas Assessments of Academic Readiness (STAAR®), AP® courses and testing, UT OnRamps and Austin Community College Dual Credit, visit the Online Learning section at
We ask for your patience, flexibility and support as we introduce a new era of learning and the exciting opportunities ahead for our teachers, students and families!
Sincerely,
Elizabeth Deterra
Assistant Superintendent for Learning and Teaching Services

h1.aria-label: Superintendent provides update on efforts to deliver online learning experiences for students
h1.span: Superintendent provides update on efforts to deliver online learning experiences for students

p.span: March 22, 2020
Dear Lake Travis ISD Staff, Parents and Guardians,

Despite this unprecedented time, it is my hope that you and your family were able to enjoy healthy and quality family time during spring break. As a reminder, we have suspended all normal school operations through Sunday, April, 5, 2020. During this time, all Lake Travis schools and facilities will be closed. The purpose of this letter is to provide you with an update regarding our efforts to deliver online learning experiences for our students during the closure.

As we continue to adjust our district operations that have been impacted by the Coronavirus, our Learning and Teaching Department has been working around the clock to ensure our teachers have the resources necessary to provide reasonable and meaningful academic instruction for more than 11,400 students in grades PK-12. On Thursday, March 26, we will launch online learning. Students and parents will be able to access online learning through Schoology, the district adopted learning management system that provides these services, as well as providing integration with other district adopted resources. We ask for your patience, support, and understanding as we introduce a new era of learning for our public schools.

Please understand that the introduction and delivery of online instruction will be a completely new and unique challenge for our teachers. You should not expect a replica of your child’s typical classroom environment or daily instructional schedule prior to the closure. Again, these are unprecedented times. I am asking everyone - students, parents, and staff - to exhibit flexibility and patience as we implement new and innovative approaches to learning and teaching.

Between Monday, March 23 and Wednesday, March 25, our teachers and support staff will finalize remote learning content and platforms. On Wednesday, March 25, parents will receive additional details and instructions for remote learning from Elizabeth Deterra, Assistant Superintendent for Learning and Teaching. As previously stated, remote learning will officially begin for students on Thursday, March 26 and will continue through at least Friday, April 3.

We recognize there will be a need for flexibility in the amount of content being delivered as well as in how students will be assessed and graded by their teachers. There are significant differences in the types of classes and in the developmental capacities of our students and in the technological capacities of our many families. We trust our teachers will navigate this new environment with great care, compassion and fairness for all students. Should you have questions regarding online instruction for your child, you are encouraged to contact your child’s teacher via email.

We understand this is a stressful and trying time for our families. I know many of you have questions regarding school events and overall plans for the remainder of the school year. For now, we are operating on the assumption that we will resume normal school operations on Monday, April 6.

Please know the health and safety of our staff, students, and families guide our decisions. Rest assured, we will do our best to provide answers in a timely and thoughtful manner. We will continue to keep you posted of any and all developments.
Wishing you and your family much health and tranquility during this time,
Brad Lancaster, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

h1.aria-label: District providing support for online instruction
h1.span: District providing support for online instruction

p.span: March 19, 2020
Dear Lake Travis ISD Staff, Parents and Guardians,

As we continue preparing for the delivery of online instruction next week, Lake Travis ISD senior staff and I will make every effort possible to assist our families in need of technical support. To that end, we have developed a Google Form for families to request such assistance.

Specifically, families who do not have home access to the Internet and/or a device to access online instruction can request such resources from our Technology and Information Systems Services Department. We ask that you complete one (1) form per child, only if needed. If you already have home access to the Internet and an alternate device of your choice, ie, desktop, laptop, tablet, smart phone, etc., you do not need to complete a form. Once we determine need, families will be notified directly regarding the date and location for device pickup.

Additionally, a number of service providers are offering free or discounted internet access for students. A list of those options are available under the ‘Technology’ section of our district’s Coronavirus website. If it is simply not feasible to access the internet from your home, please communicate with your child’s teacher to determine alternative opportunities to complete required activities.

As I have stated previously, many of you have questions about instructional content and delivery for our students. We will update you on those efforts early next week. Our goal is to begin providing online access and instruction by Thursday, March 26.

I know this is a very difficult time for our families, in particular, for those in need and facing hardship. Should you have questions or concerns regarding internet access and technology for our students, email our LTISD HelpDesk at helpdesk@ltisdschools.org.

Sincerely,
Brad Lancaster, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

h1.aria-label: District to provide free meals to children 0-18 years of age beginning Monday, March 23
h1.span: District to provide free meals to children 0-18 years of age beginning Monday, March 23

p.span: March 30, 2020
Dear Lake Travis ISD Staff, Parents and Guardians,

As we continue navigating through these uncertain times, we must remember that we are in this together. While our schools and facilities will be closed through April 13, I want to reassure you that our district will continue to provide our students with essential services to the extent possible. One such service will be providing meals from our Food and Nutrition Department.

As of Monday, March 23, Lake Travis ISD staff are providing free meals to children 0-18 years of age. Packaged breakfast and lunch will be available for pickup together between 8:30 and 10:30 a.m. at each of our three middle school campuses:

a.span: Bee Cave Middle School - 5400 Vail Divide, Austin, 78738
Hudson Bend Middle School -15600 Lariat Trail, Austin, 78734
Lake Travis Middle School - 4932 Bee Creek Road, Spicewood, 78669

p.span: Meals will be provided in drive-through fashion at the bus drop-off location at each middle school campus. Parents will not need to exit their vehicle.

As of March 26, the US Department of Agriculture now allows school districts to serve meals to a parent or guardian without his/her children having to be present in the vehicle. However, there are guidelines parents and guardians must follow.
Guided by the USDA, the Texas Department of Agriculture requires the parent or guardian to present validation of their children with any
of the following options:

li.span: Official letter/email/electronic school application from the school listing the indiviudal child's current enrollment
Report card for each individual child
Attendance record from parent portal of the school website, printed or electronic, for each individual child
School ID of each individual child

div.p: Please note, hot meals will not be provided. Instead, meals will consist of packaged cereals, sandwiches, fruits, vegetables, fruit juice, milk and/or water.

p.span: I know this is a very difficult time for our families, in particular, for those in need and facing hardship. While some of you may be eager to volunteer your time and services during our meal pickup, we must keep in mind and adhere to local and state restrictions limiting public gatherings. Our outstanding food service department has this under control. We sincerely appreciate your concern and willingness to help. For more information,

a.span: visit the Coronavirus section on the Lake Travis ISD website

p.span: , or email
Sincerely,
Brad Lancaster, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.span: The health and safety of our school community is of utmost importance as Lake Travis ISD officials continue to closely monitor the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. We are following the guidance from the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS), and local government and health officials—including our Lake Travis school board.

Events and information related to COVID-19 are changing daily—oftentimes hourly, but rest assured Lake Travis ISD stands ready to take all appropriate measures to safeguard our staff and students. In the interim, we urge our school community to continue the consistent practice of personal hygiene and social distancing.
